title: How much money do top TikTok influencers make? - Quora

response.answer_text: Great question, and one many are asking themselves these days with the explosive growth of the platform. I recently linked to Fortune’s latest article ‘TikTok’s 7 Highest-Earning Stars’, detailing last year’s income of the platform’s top creators (i.e. influencers).  Let’s have a look at what they made in the last 12 months: Addison Rae: $5 millionCharli D’Amelio: $4 millionDixie D’Amelio: $2.9 millionLoren Gray: $2.6 millionJosh Richards: $1.5 millionMichael Le: $1.2 millionSpencer X: $1.2 millionMany of the above creators also make money through other brand partnerships or get paid in kind – i.e. with products. Several also have launched their own product lines. Charli & Dixie D’Amelio, for example, have launched a Morphe makeup line. Above all this, TikTok influencers also get about 2–3 cents per 1,000 video views out of TikTok’s Creator Fund. While this does not seem like much, if all of your videos constantly get xx million views, this surely is a nice bonus. Lastly, TikTok also lets its users buy “Coins” which they can use to send Virtual Gifts to live streamers. So in short, the above stated annual revenue numbers should be taken with a grain of salt as they’ll likely be a bit higher.  💡 If you want to learn more about TikTok influencers and how to get the most out of the platform, check out this Ultimate TikTok Guide.

TitToks, Pandas, Italian hands, Love bangs, Sun cream, Rainbow puke, Concerts, and I’m very riches, they all have to be purchased with real money by your audience.  @alexmarchildon, a French Canadian TikTok creator, receives 4 TikToks from @radtrx As a TikTok content creator, when you receive a gift, TikTok sends you money. The most successful TikTok influencers spend a lot of time and effort into creating engaging TikTok lives. Here are a few TikTok influencers that might inspire you on your way to fame, glory, and riches: @chaninatasha@trinity@katjagliesonWhen you make it to TikTok live stardom, remember how anxious you were to get there. And understand that there are tons of others just like you who would love their minute of glory on your TikTok lives. Obviously, there are other ways to make money on TikTok that might involve online stores, brand sponsorship, modeling, acting, or speaking gigs. But that will come later when you have a lot more followers. In the meantime, stay true to yourself, have fun, and be creative.
